ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] grouping thread on the Everquest boards
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@yahoo.com] Sent: Tuesday, June 27, 2000 8:16 AM To: eqbards@egroups.com Subject: RE: [eqbards] grouping thread on the
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 27, 2000 8:16 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] grouping thread on the Everquest boards


--- Ioshua <Ioshua@...> wrote:

> On crowd control, how do you get a group to let you
> do it? Every time
> I try charm, mez or selective fear someone (often
> more than one) freaks
> out.

* Only charm the mob nodody is concentrating on?
* Wait until yon monk is nearly dead before bringing
relief his way? Sometimes a near-death experience
makes belivers out of people.
* Find a group of people who likes to play as a group
and welcomes effective innovation.

> And on Lament, using it at all. It worked nicely
> when I first got it
> and I loved it for a long time but haven't used it
> since the early
> twenties.

My experience has been opposite. I couln't use it for
squat at 8th lvl, but at 29, I pull with ease. I
haven't used it on more than 2 mobs at a time
successfully though...

Like many of our songs, lament gets better with age. Here is a prime example of
Lament's usefulness. I know of several high level bards (45+) on E'ci who have
successfully used Lament to break a completely spawned Lord room in LGuk. In
other words, they Lament the boks and pull the Lord by himself. Risky? Sure.
But when it works its amazing. This is probably the extreme example of the
usefulness of this song, at least in the pre-Kunark zones.

Galtin of E'ci
